intro: Eriocaulon xenopodion, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, typically growing in wetland or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that are often hidden beneath the foliage. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
